On the southern slopes of Olivet, opposite the beautiful temple of Jehovah on Mount Moriah, were the shrines and 
                                                                           405
images that had been placed there by Solomon to please his idolatrous wives. See 1 Kings 11:6-8. For upwards of three centuries the great, misshapen images had stood on the "Mount of Offense," mute witnesses to the apostasy of Israel's wisest king. These, too, were removed and destroyed by Josiah.
